tool.name: DMUtoDocx

param.name: Source_geodatabase
param.dialogReference: An existing GeMS-style geodatabase. Table DescriptionOfMapUnits should be (at least partially) populated, and HierarchyKey values should be present, as DMU table is sorted on HierarchyKey before translation to .docx file

param.name: Output_workspace
param.dialogReference: Directory in which output file will be written. Should exist and be writable.

param.name: Output_filename
param.dialogReference: Name of output file. File will be overwritten if it already exists. If filename does not end with ".docx", ".docx" will be appended to file name.

param.name: Use_MapUnit_as_UnitLabl
param.dialogReference:
Values in fields MapUnit or Label can be used for UnitLabl.

Default (use MapUnit) is recommended for constructing and proofing the DMU table. It may be useful to use Label (box unchecked) for creating a final MSWord file of the DMU.

param.name: List_of_Map_Units
param.dialogReference: If checked, creates a List of Map Units which omits map unit descriptions.

tool.summary:
Reads table DescriptionOfMapUnits in an GeMS-style geodatabase and creates "Description of Map Units" as a Microsoft Word .docx file using paragraph styles defined in USGS Pubs template MapManuscript_v1-0_04-11.dotx.

Supports some markup tags in text within the Description field: replace "(" and ")" in following with "<" and ">"

  • (b) ... (/b) bold

  • (i) ... (/i) italic

  • (g) ... (/g) FGDCGeoAge font

  • (sup)...(/sup) superscript

  • (sub)...(/sub) subscript

  • (br) break (start new paragraph)
